Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rashmmi
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful time for 3 nights, had come with riviera group travel. The hotel is pretty modern and breakfast is super. The reception people were very friendly and helpful and gave me some good suggestions. The best gem was Burro & Sago a cosy typically traditonal italian restaurant with fixed price menu which was really cheap. Quality and quantity were both amazing and I recommend every traveller to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: HenryMP
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel as part of a tour. The hotel was in our view excellent. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The room temperature can be controlled from the reception desk if you are too hot or cold. We didn't use the bar or the restaurant and therefore have no comment. The area is residential but not as sometimes stated shabby. Nor is it in any way sinister. The breakfast was fine, but with Nescafé from a machine supposedly Americano. British tourists really must get over this issue with tea. Why in the world should Italian hotels take us as their norm? The nearby restaurant Da Michele is excellent quality and, as one might expect from a smart place, not cheap, although the wine list is not at all pricey and offers some good bargains. We never ate at the pizzeria but by all accounts it was fine for the price. The metro is indeed 10-15 minutes from the hotel and gets into Rome quite quickly. The Colosseo stop is a little to the east, but Rome's centre is not big. The 'uphill' walk on the way back is very far from arduous and is not to our knowledge prone to extreme criminality. Should the hotel or the tour company have insisted on the district being flattened out? The 715 bus is convenient but not quick. It does after all serve local people who have the right to exist. Other buses in the centre can take you to the north end of the Corso. You just have to sus the system as in all major cities. If you want to stay in the centre, either you will have a less good hotel, or you will pay a lot more. So get real.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: karma_21uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights with a tour group and think this hotel was absolutely fine, no complaints. The hotel is a little bit out of Rome in a residential area but with easy access into the centre. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel or a Metro station 10-15 mins walk from the hotel. Often I just took my time walking to the station as there were shops and department stores on the way. Location wasn't a problem, if we had been staying at a hotel nearer the centre the cost would have been considerably more!! The hotel was modern and clean. I cannot fault our room. We were towards the back of the hotel overlooking apartments and the church nearby...the church was so close we could hear the organ playing at mass. We had a spacious balcony; it would have been nice to had some chairs to sit out on. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant in the evening but rather went to the nearby 'Michele's'. Good restaurant (although limited choice for vegetarians). Note that you may have to pre book here especially if there are a couple of tour groups at the hotel. Breakfast was fine, lots of choice. The usual- cereals, yoghurts, pastries/cakes, scrambled egg, bacon. Tea/coffee, juice. Sometimes you have to wait a couple of minutes for the staff to replenish but it wasn't a problem. All in all a really good hotel, I would stay here again and recommend to friends. For us it was a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for high price”
Reviews.Author: MichaBrans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly overpriced. They give you the impression to be a high-class bussines hotel but there is a lot wrong, specialy if you are in Rome for work. - The WiFi signal was strong, but the internet connection dropped very frequently (default gateway that also served als DHCP and DNS server unreachable). - The breakfast doesn't have many options to choose. The scrambled eggs were made in the early morning and not refilled with the result that, if you come at 8AM, the eggs were dry or finished. No normal orange juice (3 other juices were present). - The fitness center (that supossed to be part of the hotel) is a public gym around the corner where hotel guest can get in for free. - The restaurant (again separate entrance so you have to go outside to go to the restaurant) only offered a complete menu for the first days. We asked if it was posible just to get a main dish and they answered us that this was posible but they would still charge the total menu price. - The bar is in the breakfast room. No lounge seats or bar chairs, you have to sit on the breakfast tables. -`There are not enough orientation signals in the hotel to guide you to these "extra-places", which gives the impression of being lost there. - The staff in the reception, bar, breakfast and the restaurant didn't seem to have a good day every day (we stayed for 7 nights...)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cabbie37
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as part of a package tour with Riviera Travel. An excellent hotel in all repects, modern, clean, comfortable, great staff and very well appointed rooms. The location is a shabby residential area but you are close to a bus and metro station and plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Be warned that the walk back in the dark from the metro is not well lit and you will walk quickly! The reception area is modern and spacious and the staff are very helpful and all seem to speak English. The dining area is also comfortable and modern, the breakfast was plentiful and varied too. My only criticism is that being in Italy tea making facilities are poor with tea bag and water being on one side, milk being on the other and sugar on your table. Why do they not understand tea pots? We did not have an evening meal because it was expensive but others in our party did and were very pleased. Rooms are excellent, quality furniture and fittings, good bathrooms with ceramic bath and excellent shower. Well lit, large mirrors too. Large comfortable bed, air conditioning, fridge with complimentary water, sweets every day, tv with English channels and deep carpets. I did not want to leave! Staff, especially on reception, were really helpful and friendly. Taxis are available in minutes and info is provided on bus and metro times too. The local area is very inner city, jammed with parked vehicles and rubbish strewn everywhere, scary at night but I guess this is Italy! There are two restaurants nearby of note; Michelles which is classy, quality Italian withh good food and wine with a price to match, or Pasta and Pommodora which is a locals Pizzeria with fixed price menus and you are guarateed not to leave hungry. Both less than 5 minutes well lit walk away. So on the whole a great hotel and I reccomend it. Less than 30 mins drive from Fiumicino Airport too. All the facilities you could need. There is an nearby fitness centre with pool but not attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i'm in businessman central, and that's OK”
Reviews.Author: ChemOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I wanted a few lazy days of sightseeing and solace before I started to work in Italy. I had managed to gain 10 pounds in my first 10 days in Italy. Yikes. I had to stay in a place with a gym. This was critical. Crucial. I also need affordable and wanted to be able to take public transit. This was the only hotel (on those hotel sites) that really fit the bill and was affordable. Location: It's close in, but well outside the historic corridor. If you're plans demand a visit to St Paul's outside the walls, then this is your hotel. It's a long walk to the metro, but again... 10 lbs! So I walked to the metro station then could zip around the city. I failed bus 101, and just stuck with the metro. The hotel is a nice business class hotel and "congress" center. Well it turns out the gym is a real neighborhood fitness center (co-located in the hotel). Great facility (better that my hometown gym), nice indoor pool (wish it had been outdoor...), fine sauna, clean locker rooms, the works. Nice to mix with locals not in the service industry. If a gym (a real gym, not a hotel fitness center) is a priority, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “An alright hotel stay with a kind staff”
Reviews.Author: world-traveller13524
Reviews.Content: The Oly Hotel was a pleasant stay for my family and I. Although the rooms were quite small and some of the staff could not speak English, the hotel was still alright. From the staff that could speak English, we received a lot of help. The room was very tidy and the showers had unlimited hot water. Also, electrical outlets were easily available for charging our cameras and cell phones. In the lobby, there was free internet connection which is good for business men and women staying at the Oly Hotel. The next morning, my family and I enjoyed a great breakfast. With fresh fruit, hot chocolate, toast and jam, cereal and milk, fresh baked pastries, eggs, cheese, and so much more. The service was really great in the restaurant. Although the Oly Hotel was not the best hotel stay in my life, it most definitely was not the worst. As we toured around Roma we discovered that the Oly Hotel was the only 4 star hotel. All the other hotels we came across had 3 stars or under. So if you are going to Roma, the Oly Hotel is a comfortable experience, however, if one has younger children, it is quite a walk to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “A suitable place for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Stuartbuxton
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights here with Riviera Travel. Overall the place was not too bad, and although the staff were a little remote, they were never less than polite. The food at breakfast was adequate - no more, no less. The catering staff were swamped by numbers though, and this is hardly excusable as they surely knew how many to expect for breakfast. We had one evening meal at the Oly and it was quite good and served in a professional manner. The room was reasonable and clean, but perhaps a little smaller than we were led to believe. Our bathroom facilities were reasonable, although it did take a while for the bath to fill. A number of our fellow travellers, however, did experience some problems with both the toilet and bath. The hotel is situated in a quietish area about 1Km from the Metro and very near the bus stop. The route to the Metro is "decorated" with graffiti - which is sadly endemic throughout Rome - and this can give a feeling of menace around the area. However, we never felt intimidated or threatened. Overall the Oly was ok and suitable for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that relies on captive groups and doesn't seem interested in attracting people back.”
Reviews.Author: dervalsut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with Riviera, and were forewarned by the reviews. But first of all it is not true to say that there are no other places to eat other than the hotel, go right, right and right again and the Michele is on your left, or go right, then left into the Via Antonio Pia,then take the first small road on the right which winds through a residential area and the Burro & Sugo is on your right as the road descends. Just a little farther on , on the Viale Leonardo da Vinci is a pizzeria and the Mozzarella & Pomodora. All these places had good reports from our group although the Michele was thought to be a bit expensive. The food in the hotel was poor. Breakfast was what you would expect when it is described as "continental" but that does not excuse the "orange " juice that was a purple pink colour and tasted of water, nor the eggs which were not just hard boiled but refrigerated and the coffee machine broke down. The croissants were the best things there. Almost all of us opted to eat in the hotel the first night - the set meal was 30 euros. I suppose it was not too bad but very ... s.l.o.w. Most people went out the next night but we stayed in and wished we hadn't. The pasta was cold and tasteless, the main came with "salad" which turned out to be wet, refrigerated green beans, served late. This meal too was very slow and that was strange with so few people to serve. We sat there for about three and a half hours, taking advantage of the free wine. If the meal had been better and efficiently served we would not have had so much. We heard that one group had refused to sign for the meal. We complained to the manager as we were leaving and he said he thought it was good value for money. No, it was not! We asked if anyone else had complained and he said, rather revealingly, "Not this morning!" We didn't like the bar, it is below ground and does not have a relaxing atmosphere, being all black polished surfaces with hardly any chairs, not the sort of place you would want to spend any time at all, in fact it was bleak. The prices were 6euros for a small bottle of beer and 8euros for a gin and tonic. On the plus side the hotel was clean, and our room was fine. That said we would not want to go back there and it is a twenty minute walk to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: damudi
Reviews.Content: Room very confortable and quiet Breakfast range anf food quality good Location close to Metro station for sightseeing No bar but this was not a significant issue

Reviews.Title: “Good Room - Shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: AncientBritton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with Riviera Trave in a twin bed room with B&B. On the way to the hotel, the rep offered us the chance to eat in the hotel resaurant for 30 euros each. There were only two options, fish or meat. We chose the meat - a cheesy thing, Ravioli in a mushroom sauce, a chicken roll with roast potatos and salad, a fruit salad plus free beverages. Wine on the table was ok but I wanted a glass of beer. I had to ask three times and waited half an hour. The food was mediocre at best. The roast potatos were chips so hard that you could break your teeth on them and the salad did not arrive until we had all finished. My wife left most of hers. The monkfish on the fish menue looked like two small sardines. The bar only sold expesive small bottles of beer, no draught. A very espensive meal of bland ingredients - £60 for two. Later I found a Pizza take away where you could sit at a table, inside or out. We had two large freshly made pizzas, two 66cc bottles of beer and a can of Sprite for a total of 15 euro. Skip the hotel and go there.... Out through the main entrance, turn right, then left, then left again. Walk along half a mile until you come to a T junction, passing a good reasonably priced bar on the way. Turn left at the junction and continue to Facolta Della Pizza - super food and value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, except very poor air conditioner, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: IlanaM
Reviews.Content: Good: 1. Very clean room and bathroom. 2.10 min maximum to walk to Blue Metro Station San Paolo and only 4 stations to Central Station Termini. Very close to old city. 3. The pool was for Free!!! 4. We stayed 8 nights. $150 for a night. This is cheap for such a hotel in Rome. 5. Hotel staff were very nice and helpful. Bad: 1. Air Condition was not working good, therefor we opened windows at night and mosquito were all over us. At hot weather, this will not be so good for you. October to April this will not be such a problem. 2. No good place to eat near hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel clean but breakfast a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lesley0309
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean but breakfast was a little disappointing, we had to wait for more cakes, cheese and ham. We were with Riviera Travel and were told we could not eat in the room where the Italians ate for breakfast. After a rather heated discussion, we were eventually allowed to! We reported this to reception who seemed surprised and sympathetic. They clearly could not cope with the number of guests for breakfast .We had to pay 20 Euros for the pool which I thought was rather steep for a quick swim.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the pool.......”
Reviews.Author: cornishmaid42
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Hotel Oly earlier this month. Whilst the rooms etc were fine we were dismayed to be told that we would have to pay 20Euros each per day if we wanted to use the pool!!!! I've never heard of such a thing - all we wanted was a quick swim after busy and hot days out and about in the city - we didn't want to use all the fitness suite etc. Took the edge off our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not preferable”
Reviews.Author: frannyUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as part of Cities of Italy with Riviera Travel. Room and facilities perfectly adequate but air con did not seem to be effective. Breakfast buffet rather disappointing - very watery juice and only tinned fruit. Coffee via a machine resulted in queues. Opted for a set meal in hotel on first night - silver service of antipasta/pasta/meat/dessert +wine for E30 was enjoyable. Several people ate at nearby restaurant on night 2. Bus 156 stops near to hotel for central Rome but a long bumpy ride. Metro stop Basilica St Paul is several blocks away over rough ground. It meant we would stay in Rome all day and evening instead of coming back for a rest and refresh. Tip: Do visit the Basilica St Paul - largest church in Rome and a lovely spacious, serene atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Cypressa
Reviews.Content: Some people seem very hard to please. The breakfast was more than ample - certainly a good deal better than the cake people seem to have become fixated on. One has to expect things to be different away from home. The room was scrupulously clean, well decorated and the whole hotel was non-smoking. I agree that the receptionist was a bit up himself, but he did produce a taxi when asked within minutes of the request. The nearest Metro station isn't too far, though an uphill trek on the way back, but there are some useful shops on the way. And at only one Euro a trip, is very good value. Apart from a neighbourhood barking dog, the area is quiet - rather better than being in the noisy centre if you have trouble in sleeping. The Riviera people would not use this hotel if it were not up to scratch. We would have liked a kettle, but these are rare in continental Europe. Yes, the air conditioning doesn't function in April, but the windows can be opened, which is fine.

Reviews.Title: “good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: elizwis
Reviews.Content: There were a few things wrong with this hotel such as a snooty receptionist and no air conditioning ( it was quite warm in April although the Italians did not think so!). However, it was clean,we had a good sized room, and a well equipped bathroom, there was plenty of variation at breakfast - fruit, cereal, cheese, ham, cakes etc although it could be a bit crowded at busier times. I thought it was well placed. There was a bus stop 1 min. walk away. The 715 takes you all the way to the P. Venezia. It was a 15 min. walk to the Metro where we never had to wait more than a few mins. for a train. It only took 15-20 mins. to get into Rome altho' the metro stations aren't near all tourist places. We did not find the area to be unsafe and never saw any petty crime or drug dealing! People walking their dogs the only Italians we met. There were at least three good places to eat in the area: Michaelas, Pomodoro&Mozerella, and a small trattoria run by a rugby fanatic(his brother plays for Italy).

Reviews.Title: “good base for sights”
Reviews.Author: paddy012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Oly for 4 nights with our 13 month old son. It served as a good base for many of the tourist sights and was less than 10 mins walk to the nearest metro station. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was adequate but once we had a travel cot added in the space was very limited. The hotel is advertised as having air conditioning, but unfortunately this was switched off for winter - despite the fact that temperatures were still in the high teens and twenties. It also states that it has an indoor pool - however access is restricted to approx 3 times per day - usually mid morning, early afternoon and late evening.

Reviews.Title: “A Non-Smoker's Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra80
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, extremely tired from a long flight. We were "greeted" by a grumpy hotel attendant who rudely gave us the keys to our room. As soon as we walked through the doors of the hotel room, it reeked like a smoke-filled Vegas Casino & it had dirty, yellow-stained, peeling wallpaper. (We are both non-smokers and had specifically asked for a non-smoking room) The hotel attendant told us that no rooms were available that night.--they would see what they could do the following day. That night we came back after dinner & there was a sign at the front desk that said "Ask hotel clerk about tours of Rome". So, we asked the hotel clerk and he stared at us dumbfounded & said he did not understand. I pointed to the sign beside him & he said he did not know about any tours. The next morning we went for breakfast at 9:30 (breakfast was served until 10 am). We were grumpy b/c we were on the 1st floor & there was some type of a convention going on that woke us up very early in the morning. As we walked to the breakfast room we had to pass through a waiting room, where there was about 100 people smoking in a tiny room. As we walked through the crowd to the breakfast room.. I thought I would be ill inhaling the fumes. When we got inside, there was no food or eating utensils to be seen, except for a few revolting hard boiled eggs. We then had to cross back through the smoke-filled reception room again to get to the front desk. We explained the problem to the hotel attendant (a different one than the night before & from when we checked in).. He said, "I don't understand what you're saying". I made a hand gesture of eating out of bowl and he still could not understand what I was trying to say. We finally were able to explain the problem & the hotel attendant said, "This is impossible!" -(-He suddenly spoke fluent english with us.) I said "No, really, there's no food, and nothing to eat out of." After minutes of back & forth the situation was finally resolved. I was one hungry, smoke-infested, cranky, sleepless person that morning. I aslo had to take another shower after breakfast b/c I smelled like smoke. All in-all, we give a rating of "terrible" Oh-! & it's a twenty minute walk to the subway station.. it's also uphill on the way back from the subway station..perfect, after a long day of sightseeing. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Hotel or you would be Extremely sorry... a true nightmare”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyMD
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome, here's my two cents for anyone who falls into this freaking Mafia Oly Hotel trap in Rome, Italy. 1- The location of this Hotel is in middle of NO-Where and not to mention that the hotel in situated in the farthest away unsafe neighborhood 2- the rooms are dirty, smelly, small and having a super dirty bathrooms 3-The front desk is rude and money hungry, all they want is your EUROS 4- DO not trust the Hotel to recommend you any in-city or outer-city tours. 5-The Hotel maid and staff are lousy and less than helpful 6- The breakfast is a big fat joke: a few old and moldy cakes with overly old coffee... Save yourself a headache and get a Hotel near city even if it's 1 star Hotel and don't ever think about staying at OLY.

Reviews.Title: “OK but terrible for a romantic tourist”
Reviews.Author: wisborough
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is clean but shabby,[gruby walls,broken ceiling tiles etc] The breakfast is fine especially if you like cake first thing ! All in all we were comfortable enough in the Hotel. The problem is the location.You have a 15/20min walk to the metro through a fairly run down area,you then have up to 30mins on the metro to get to the main attractions.[which seem all to be a further 20mins walk.]Quite a trek before you even begin a day of sight-seeing.This however is not the worst aspect,that comes in the evening.You either have to repeat the journey to find bars/restaurants or put up with the local amenities ie the canteen like Hotel,one ok local resaurant or one tatty snack bar. If,like us one of the great pleasures of foreign travel is an evening walk,a glass of wine at a pavement cafe,and a romantic dinner,then the Oly is a total dead loss. We felt cheated of some of Romes best experiences because our tour company Riviera use such a badly located Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little out the way”
Reviews.Author: FrostD
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little hotel to stay in. I was in Rome on business so being close the main tourist attractions wasn't too important. The hotel is fairly clean and the staff friendly enough. I never actually got round to having dinner here but breakfast is similar to the other hotels, in that they normally serve cold meats with cheese. Many of the other hotels in Rome are a lot more expensive, however an many cases you are paying for location rather than service. All in all a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “(--) Hotel I have ever stayed -Save yourself and book somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: NYWorldtravelers
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome two nights ago. My wife and I decided to celebrate our first and special anniversary in Rome, Italy. We booked our flight and Hotel online thru Expeida and although we read the travelers reviews to be moderately low about Oly Hotel we decided to give it try. Let me mention that my wife and I are world travelers (Platinum airline mileage members) and we have stayed in many hotels all around the world. The Oly Hotel by far is the worse experience we have EVER had. I like to remind you that Oly Hotel ranks itself to be a 4 star hotel!!! And their base price for two people is $291.00 Euros. They located 20 kilometers away from Rome City Center and the closet metro station (sao paula basilica) to the Hotel is 25 ~ 30 minutes unsafe walk from the Hotel. Oly Hotel located in a very unsafe surrounding neighborhood with prostitutes walking around and drug deal takes place in the side walk. We arrived at mid-night in Rome after a very long 20 hour flight and train ride. To start we had to stay 1 hour for the Hotel manager to find us a key to the room. Even though we had requested a queen bed-Non-Smoking room, the hotel manager provided us double smoking room with two separate beds and a broken window without a lock. We asked if we could change the room, so he put us in another room with a broken door and window! We asked to change the room again for the third time; he put us in smaller smoking room with two separate beds with a both broken door-lock and broken in-room safe. Lastly, he suggested that we should change our room the next day, cuz he did not have a clean room available...as if we had nothing better to do to stay around the Hotel the next day for a clean room. What concerned us the most was the broken lock to our room. The cleaning people are extremely Rude and less than helpful. You basically have to ask for everything:” Shampoo, clean towels, and even request them to change the sheets- we complained once to the maids to leave our hotel room door close after they were done, they got pissed off and decided not to CLEAN OUT ROOM the next day or provide us clean towels that we asked numerously. The breakfast is lousy, as well. The bread was old and moldy. The fruits are rotten, the ham and cheese which suppose to be the highlight of the meal are warm smelly and tasteless/scary to eat. The coffee machine is a generic coffee-maker with usually a long line in the morning. You’re lucky to get anything to eat after 9:00 am!! even though the breakfast is suppose to end at 10:00. So, save yourself to asking for refill on anything because it’s impossible to get anything replenished. We decided to complain to the Morning manager “Julio” about the housekeeping not changing our sheets. He looked at our face straight saying he did not believe the housekeeping didn’t do their job. It felt like they were all in it together. The front desk attendants are useless and rude and DO NOT TRUST their recommendation on tours they suggest. Most tours they offer are overpriced and the Hotel gets some kick-back out of it. You can go to and tourist information anywhere and get a better deal. We are going to write to the Italian Hotel/tourist bureau about our experience. We like to ask Expedia to not refer them on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Easy transport into Rome”
Reviews.Author: LizNorthampton
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly comfortable hotel with a good bus service from across the road into the centre of Rome.Metro about 15 minutes walk-not so good on your return after a heavy day's sightseeing. Breakfast is poor ,no good unless you like cake for breakfast! When breakfast items are finished i.e. hard-boiled eggs they don't replenish them so get to Breakfast in good time. Dinner is a-la -carte,not bad but on the pricey side.All in all not bad for price & in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It suited the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Bigmarkh
Reviews.Content: Went ther as part of a trip with Riveria Travel UK. The hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice and suited what i needed. Food at breakfast very lack luster and tea and coffee is in flasks which you pour yourself. No hot food at breakfast. your usual ham and cheese type stuff which us english are not keen on. overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go at World Cup time !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff in Reception charming and helpful. Rooms clean and comfortable, well serviced. Had one meal in the evening, when Italy were playing in the World Cup. Vegetables were brought in on platters and left to go cold while we waited for the meat. There was a great shortage of potatoes, and a complaint had to be made before any more were produced. Food was not of 3* standard. One can do much better by eating out at a nearby restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: Oly Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Santuario Regina degli Apostoli 36, 00145 Rome, Italy
